item.title: 602. Chris Fowler Discusses Differences Between College & NFL Game
item.itunes:title: 602. Chris Fowler Discusses Differences Between College & NFL Game
item.description:
Daniel Jeremiah and Bucky Brooks are back with a special new episode. To start off, the guys react to Dolphins QB Ryan Fitzpatrick's response to the team naming QB Tua Tagovailoa the starter (2:23). Next, the pair reference the Tampa Bay Rays and talk about the importance of depth in the NFL and getting the most out of players on their rookie contracts (8:43). Then, the guys discuss the breaking news of the Vikings trading DE Yannick Ngakoue to the Ravens (11:01). Following that, the duo look at WR Antonio Brown's fit with the Seahawks, if he ends up signing with the team (16:22). After that, DJ and Bucky give their expectations for Ohio State QB Justin Fields, as he plays his first game of the season on Saturday against Nebraska (21:21). To wrap up the show, DJ is joined by ESPN's Chris Fowler, as he touches on the differences of calling a NFL vs. college game, how college football compares to the NFL in terms of physicality and game speed, emphasizes the presence of some of the top college coaches and more (23:24).

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: 601. Differences of Being a Left-Handed QB + Reaction to Tua Named as Dolphins' Starting QB
item.itunes:title: 601. Differences of Being a Left-Handed QB + Reaction to Tua Named as Dolphins' Starting QB
item.description:
Daniel Jeremiah and Bucky Brooks are back with a special new episode. To start off, the guys react to the news of Dolphins QB Tua Tagovailoa being named the starter (1:23). Next, former NFL QB Boomer Esiason joins as he discusses the differences of being a left-handed and right-handed QB and he also gives his take on Tua (4:15). Then, former Bengals WR Cris Collinsworth talks to DJ and Bucky about what it's like catching a ball from a left-handed QB, as he did from Boomer Esiason (6:16). After, former NFL QB Mark Brunell gives insight about his experience as a left-handed QB (10:37). Following that, former NFL coach Steve Mariucci speaks on what he noticed from coaching a left-handed QB vs. a right-handed QB (14:41). To wrap up the show, former NFL QB Michael Vick touches on being a left-handed QB and explains why he believes in Tua (19:47).

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.itunes:title: 595. Reaction to Bill O'Brien's Firing
item.description:
Daniel Jeremiah and Bucky Brooks are back with a special new episode. To start off, the guys break down the Patriots vs. Chiefs game and the Falcons vs. Packers MNF matchup (:12). Then, the pair react to the Texans firing head coach and GM Bill O'Brien, while also discussing why this vacant position is a good job and giving names of potential candidates to fill it (8:18). After that, the duo point out the Cowboys and their lack of effort on defense, and they also respond to quotes from Cowboys head coach Mike McCarthy and owner Jerry Jones (28:32). To wrap up the show, the guys analyze North Dakota State QB Trey Lance's one-game showcase from this past weekend (42:28).

To start off, the guys react to the news of the Big Ten returning to play in the fall and the Pac-12 potentially doing the same, while also looking at what players who opted out of the season before this news could do and why they should be allowed to opt back in (2:24). Next, the pair analyze how Jaguars CB C.J. Henderson did in Week 1 and follow it by a discussion of grading players differently if they play in 2020 vs. not play (21:08). Then, the duo discuss how 12 personnel is on the rise in the NFL (27:42). To wrap up the show, the guys preview the Bengals vs. Browns Thursday Night Football game by saying what they're watching out for (31:40).

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: 585. 10 Takeaways from Week 1
item.itunes:title: 585. 10 Takeaways from Week 1
item.description:
Daniel Jeremiah, Bucky Brooks and Rhett Lewis look back at the weekend and pick ten storylines that stood out from Week 1 of the NFL season. To start off, the guys discuss what they saw from Bengals QB Joe Burrow in his rookie debut against the Chargers (1:55). Later, the trio look at Ravens QB Lamar Jackson's big game in a win vs. the Browns (8:20). The guys also explain why you shouldn't doubt Packers QB Aaron Rodgers after his dominant performance at Minnesota (18:37). Then, DJ and Bucky emphasize how their pinky promise is looking good after the Cardinals beat the 49ers (28:02). To wrap up the show, Rhett explains why the Falcons have too much talent to be trailing the whole game like they did vs. the Seahawks (33:06). All that and more in this packed episode.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: 584. David Shaw on the Chiefs' Win, Adjusting to the Pandemic & His Recruiting Philosophy
item.itunes:title: 584. David Shaw on the Chiefs' Win, Adjusting to the Pandemic & His Recruiting Philosophy
item.description:
Daniel Jeremiah and Bucky Brooks are back with a special new episode. To start off, the guys talk about if the Texans vs. Chiefs kickoff game felt normal since the teams didn't have a preseason to prepare and DJ gives his initial scouting report on Chiefs RB Clyde Edwards-Helaire from when he was coming out of LSU (:37). After that, Stanford head football coach David Shaw joins to discuss the Chiefs win over the Texans, the influence of the college game on the NFL, adjusting during the pandemic and his recruiting philosophy (6:40). Then, DJ and Bucky look at Patriots CB Stephon Gilmore's raise and do a further discussion on the value of contracts across different positions (40:16). To wrap up the show, the pair talk about how more undrafted free agents are being stashed on practice squads compared to ever before (47:29).

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: 581. Steve Wyche & Jim Trotter on Social Justice
item.itunes:title: 581. Steve Wyche & Jim Trotter on Social Justice
item.description:
Daniel Jeremiah and Bucky Brooks are back with a special new episode. To start off, the guys react to the Jaguars releasing running back Leonard Fournette and trading defensive end Yannick Ngakoue to the Vikings (1:28). Next, the duo talk about two college prospects in unique situations (9:43). Then, NFL Network's Steve Wyche and Jim Trotter join the podcast to discuss social justice, playing in an environment with the pandemic, getting more players from HBCUs into the NFL and to talk about the mission of their new podcast "Huddle and Flow" (15:18). To wrap up the show, the guys preview their interview with Raiders GM Mike Mayock as he touches on the challenges of evaluating a roster without preseason games (54:44).

item.title: 579. Peter Schrager Joins to Talk Earl Thomas' Release & Hard Knocks
item.itunes:title: 579. Peter Schrager Joins to Talk Earl Thomas' Release & Hard Knocks
item.description:
Daniel Jeremiah and Bucky Brooks are back with a special new episode. Peter Schrager of "Good Morning Football" joins the guys for the podcast. To start off, the trio react to Earl Thomas' release from the Ravens (1:17). Next, Peter Schrager comments on Giants head coach Joe Judge's approach to coaching (7:08). To follow that, the guys look at what the Jets have done this offseason (11:12). Then, Peter Schrager gives insight into "Hard Knocks" and further talks about the two head coaches in it (14:51). After that, the trio discuss what to expect from Patriots QB Cam Newton this season (18:17). Next, the guys examine the value of Chiefs rookie RB Clyde Edwards-Helaire and mention other rookies to keep an eye on (22:15). To wrap up the show, Peter Schrager gives his surprise team for 2020 (26:40).

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: 577. Rookies to Keep an Eye On in Training Camp
item.itunes:title: 577. Rookies to Keep an Eye On in Training Camp
item.description:
Daniel Jeremiah and Bucky Brooks are back with a new episode. To start off, the guys list rookies to keep an eye on in training camp as padded practices start today for most teams (9:18). Next, the pair look at Packers nose tackle Kenny Clark's contract extension and then talk about the talent on the Cowboys' defense which complements their offensive weapons (21:25). After that, the duo explain why the expansion of the practice squad should be permanent (28:06). Then, the guys discuss how special Penn State linebacker Micah Parsons is (32:02). Next, the guys hit on the news of Jason Wright being named the team president of the Washington Football Team and also QB Alex Smith being activated off the PUP list (34:29). To wrap up the show, DJ and Bucky pay tribute to the passing of longtime offensive line coach Howard Mudd by looking back at a conversation they had with him last year (45:20).

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: 576. Lance Zierlein on Scouting College Opt Outs
item.itunes:title: 576. Lance Zierlein on Scouting College Opt Outs
item.description:
Bucky Brooks is back with a new episode with special guest Lance Zierlein. To start off, the guys react to 49ers tight end George Kittle's contract extension (:39) and defensive end Everson Griffen signing with the Cowboys (4:30). After, the pair look at Jadeveon Clowney being a free agent (9:13). Next, the duo react to episode 1 of Hard Knocks and discuss how teams are adjusting to the pandemic during training camp (13:28). Then, the guys discuss the differences and challenges of scouting college opt outs and also touch on the Big Ten and Pac-12 postponing fall college football (16:27). To wrap up the show, Bucky and Lance talk about some of the best college QBs and their skill sets (28:35).

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: 573. Impact of NFL & College Players Opting Out
item.itunes:title: 573. Impact of NFL & College Players Opting Out
item.description:
Daniel Jeremiah and Bucky Brooks are back with a new episode. To start off, the guys discuss why this is a good year for teams to play fast (3:28). Next, the duo examine how the Saints are creating an individual team bubble during training camp where players can voluntarily stay at a hotel (17:08). After that, the pair talk about the impact of NFL players opting out of the 2020 season on the salary cap and give ideas of what teams could do with extensions of other players (24:33). Then, the guys look at the notable college football players that have decided to opt out and if that decision affects their draft stocks (29:27). To wrap up the show, DJ and Bucky each give their analysis on two of the college players that opted out (45:59).

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.description:
Daniel Jeremiah and Bucky Brooks are back with a new episode. To start off, the guys react to the New York Jets trading safety Jamal Adams to the Seattle Seahawks (:27). The pair give their unique perspectives as DJ worked with Jets GM Joe Douglas and Bucky with Seahawks GM John Schneider. The duo also discuss the foundation of each team and Jamal Adams' value. To wrap up the show, DJ and Bucky quickly look at the NFC West and AFC East (27:27).

item.description:
Daniel Jeremiah and Bucky Brooks are back with a new episode. To start off, the guys have a conversation about players staying in shape before reporting to camp (4:07). Next, the duo react to the new name of the Washington Football Team (7:50). After that, Atlanta Falcons general manager Thomas Dimitroff joins to talk about scouting during these uncertain times and adapting to virtual environments and interactions (12:37). Then, DJ evaluates college players he's been watching and Bucky gives his analysis also (20:38). To wrap up the show, DJ and Bucky look at the potential impact of certain college prospects playing for a team that may not have a season (30:08).

item.title: How Rookies Can Adapt With No Preseason
item.itunes:title: How Rookies Can Adapt With No Preseason
item.description:
Daniel Jeremiah and Bucky Brooks are back with a new episode. To start off, the guys react to the news of how often the NFL will be testing players due to the pandemic (1:33). Next, the duo look at how rookies will adapt with no preseason and other adjustments that players and teams will have to make without a preseason (4:55). After that, the pair discuss the challenges of preparing for a team with new pieces and also talk about why teams that could trade future picks for players (14:14). To wrap up the show, DJ and Bucky explain how this unique season could impact the future of coaches that could be on the hot seat (22:03).

item.title: MTS Football/Baseball Crossover Part 1: General Managers
item.itunes:title: MTS Football/Baseball Crossover Part 1: General Managers
item.description:
Move the Sticks presents a special crossover episode focusing on Football and Baseball team building, how they relate and differ. Daniel Jeremiah and Bucky Brooks got to talk to a wide array of influential voices in the MLB. Part one will focus on the general managers, building teams, what they look for in players and more. Chicago Cubs GM Jed Hoyer (2:46) joins the show first to talk competitiveness and accessing outlier players like Russell Wilson. Twins GM Thad Levine (15:18) was next and he touched on balancing his roster between beating the division and winning in the postseason and the core traits he looks for in baseball players. Former Rockies GM Dan O'Dowd (29:45) discussed sports specialization and how we need more multi-sport athletes at the high school level and at what age he starts evaluating players.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Dave Roberts on Mindset of a Comeback & Importance of Managing Relationships
item.itunes:title: Dave Roberts on Mindset of a Comeback & Importance of Managing Relationships
item.description:
Daniel Jeremiah and Bucky Brooks are back with a new episode. item.title: Which Teams Closed the Gap on their Division Leader?
item.itunes:title: Which Teams Closed the Gap on their Division Leader?
item.description:
Daniel Jeremiah and Bucky Brooks are back with a new episode. On this episode the guys look at every division in the league and discuss which teams closed the gap on their division leader. They start with the AFC with the AFC East (1:21), AFC North (6:45), AFC South (12:26) and the AFC West (16:40). Then the pair go through the NFC with the NFC East (22:25), NFC North (26:07), NFC South (31:19) and to wrap up, the NFC West (41:41).

item.title: Full Draft Recap + Best Value Picks by Round
item.itunes:title: Full Draft Recap + Best Value Picks by Round
item.description:
Daniel Jeremiah and Bucky Brooks are back with a special new episode following the conclusion of the 2020 NFL Draft. To start off, the guys discuss the predictions they made before the draft that ended up happening (3:25). After that, they recap the draft by breaking down multiple picks and analyzing which teams got better. Next, the pair look at the Eagles philosophy in drafting QB Jalen Hurts (28:35). Then, the duo discuss the Saints re-signing QB Taysom Hill and also signing QB Jameis Winston (34:10). To wrap up the show, the guys each give their best value picks by round (38:44).

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.description:
Bucky Brooks and Rhett Lewis are back with a new episode. To start off, the guys are joined by Lance Zierlein to react to the news of the Patriots trading tight end Rob Gronkowski to the Buccaneers (:30). After that, Bucky and Rhett examine why the Giants are spending time researching Oregon QB Justin Herbert (9:54). Next, the pair discuss prospects that they think are the safest picks in the draft (12:58) and also the riskiest picks (19:58). Then, the duo look at the deepest position groups in the draft and predict how many offensive tackles, wide receivers and cornerbacks could go in the first round (26:15). To wrap up the show, Bucky and Rhett pick names of prospects that could be surprise first-rounders (42:40).

item.title: Tua Tagovailoa 360
item.itunes:title: Tua Tagovailoa 360
item.description:
Who is Tua Tagovailoa? Daniel Jeremiah and Bucky Brooks take a deep look at one of the top QB prospects of the 2020 NFL Draft in their annual 360 series. The two scouts look past the tape and talk to those closest around Tua. How important is family to him? Has he recovered from the hip injury that prematurely ended his 2019 season at Alabama? Did he always know he would unseat Jalen Hurts? DJ sat down with Galu and Diane (6:28), Tua's parents, to talk about their family dynamic, what football means to him, and how they rallied around him after he hurt his hip. Vince Passas (19:01), Tua's high school QB coach, got a chance to chat with DJ about what he was like in high school and how he showed signs of leadership back then. Kirk Herbstreit (29:28) raved about his experience with Tua and how he saw how special he was in a closed practice before the National Championship game. Trent Dilfer (38:31) had nothing but heaps of praise for the young QB, calling him "the best prospect" he's ever seen. Finally, Tua sat down with NFL Network's Steve Wyche (54:17) to update everyone on his recovery and how he's communicating with teams in the midst of COVID-19.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.itunes:title: Favorite Player by Round + Michael Pittman Jr.
item.description:
Rhett Lewis and Lance Zierlein are in for DJ and Bucky with a week to go before the 2020 NFL Draft. To start off, the hosts discuss their ideal top two picks for each of the teams selecting in the top five (Bengals, Redskins, Lions, Giants, Dolphins) (2:50). Next, the guys go round-by-round selecting their favorite players who might be selected in each phase of the draft (32:20). Finally, the Lance interviews Michael Pittman Jr., a standout wide receiver out of USC that is expected to be selected late in the first round or early in the second (1:04:30).

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.description:
On this special episode, DJ is joined by Peter Schrager. DJ selects the odd number picks and Schrager selects the even picks in this mock draft. Find out which quarterbacks will go in the first round, which position group is the deepest and if there are any surprise players that will sneak into the first round.

item.title: Joe Burrow 360
item.itunes:title: Joe Burrow 360
item.description:
Who is Joe Burrow? Daniel Jeremiah and Bucky Brooks take a deep look at the likely No. 1 overall draft pick of the upcoming 2020 NFL Draft in their annual 360 series. The two scouts look past the tape and talk to those closest around Burrow. What was he like as a kid? Did he want to play basketball instead of football? What was he like at OSU? The guys first talk to his dad, Jimmy Burrow (3:46) and his brother, Dan Burrow (18:25) as they learn more about what Joe was like as a kid. Did he compete? What sports did he play? DJ and Bucky got to chat with his first college football head coach, Urban Meyer (24:12), about what he was like in those early days. Speaking of OSU, have you seen that tire drill he did while there? His former teammates J.K. Dobbins (26:50) and Chase Young (28:07) sound off about it and why they're not shocked he is who he is. Who could forget about what he did at LSU this year? Certainly not his teammates as Bucky got a chance to sit down with Clyde Edwards-Helaire (29:29), Thaddeus Moss (32:46), Justin Jefferson (34:35) and K'Lavon Chaisson (36:26). Kirk Herbstreit (40:54) joined DJ to talk about what he saw from Joe during his 2019 season, while Bucky caught up with Jordan Palmer (46:05) at the Combine to talk about how Burrow's always had the abilities he showed off in '19. Finally, NFL Network's own Colleen Wolfe and Andrew Hawkins got to chat with Joe Burrow (54:02) at the 2020 NFL Scouting Combine.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Top 5 Risk/Reward Players & Kirk Herbstreit Talks Prospects
item.itunes:title: Top 5 Risk/Reward Players & Kirk Herbstreit Talks Prospects
item.description:
Daniel Jeremiah and Bucky Brooks are back with a new episode. To start off, Bucky discusses the movement in his updated top 5 prospects by position (1:20). Next, the guys give names of high energy players in this draft class (3:42). After that, the pair each pick 5 prospects that will come with a risk, but can also have a huge reward (11:18). Then, college football analyst Kirk Herbstreit joins the show, as he talks about a variety of college football topics and he compares Ohio State edge rusher Chase Young to the Bosa brothers (22:20). To wrap up the show, the duo emphasize how talented Chase Young is (33:13).

item.title: Justin Herbert 360
item.itunes:title: Justin Herbert 360
item.description:
Who is Justin Herbert? Daniel Jeremiah and Bucky Brooks take a deep look at the talented Oregon QB ahead of the 2020 NFL Draft in their annual 360 series. The two scouts look past the tape and talk to those closest around Herbert to see what he's like. Is he a leader? How competitive is he? Has football always been his first love? First up is Herbert's high school football coach Lane Johnson (5:00), who talked about Justin's early playing days and how he blossomed into a leader. High school basketball coach Daniel Clark (17:12) shared stories of Herbert's competitiveness in basketball games, while Oregon Strength & Conditioning Coordinator Aaron Feld (23:47) revealed how he had to hold Justin back in the weight room. Justin's Oregon teammate, Brady Aiello (32:09), shed some insight on what it was like to room with Herbert and also how the team received him when he first joined the team. Finally, DJ and Bucky got to sit down and talk to Herbert (36:56) at his pro day. This is Justin Herbert's MTS 360.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.itunes:title: Draft Prospects with the Highest Ceiling & Chasing the Chiefs in the AFC West

item.title: Players Rising Up Draft Boards & Draft Prospect Debates
item.itunes:title: Players Rising Up Draft Boards & Draft Prospect Debates
item.description:
Daniel Jeremiah and Bucky Brooks are back with a new episode. To start off, the guys discuss players that are rising up draft boards around the league (1:13). Then, the duo each give their take on the announcement of the draft going on as scheduled (17:55). Next, the pair react to the news of the Cowboys engaging in contract talks with QB Dak Prescott again (23:25). After that, the guys look at draft prospect debates going on in draft rooms (26:18). Then, DJ gives a cornerback prospect that should be talked about more (35:00). To wrap up the show, the pair explain the way touches could change for running backs going into their second contracts. (37:42).

item.title: Reaction to Cam Newton's Release & Challenges GMs are Currently Facing
item.itunes:title: Reaction to Cam Newton's Release & Challenges GMs are Currently Facing
item.description:
Daniel Jeremiah, Bucky Brooks and Rhett Lewis are back with a new episode. To start off, the guys react to Cam Newton's release from the Panthers and predict potential landing spots (2:06). Next, the trio discuss how general managers want to potentially move the draft back and the impact of everything going on in the world has on scouting departments (17:41). Then, the trio answer if they would be comfortable taking Alabama QB Tua Tagovailoa in the top 5 of the draft, as it's tough to get a medical evaluation on him (25:38). After that, the guys look at the Panthers trading QB Kyle Allen to the Redskins and what it means for each team, while also analyzing how Panthers head coach Matt Rhule is building the team (29:54). To wrap up the show, the crew discuss if the Bucs are more or less likely to take a QB in the first round after signing Tom Brady and look at a few different draft scenarios, which involve Utah State QB Jordan Love (40:43).

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.itunes:title: What Will Teams Who Acquired Extra Picks Do? + Answering Listener Questions
item.description:
Daniel Jeremiah and Bucky Brooks are back with a new episode. To start off, the guys break down what teams who acquired extra picks through trades will do in the draft (2:03). Then, the duo discuss cluster rankings of draft prospects and compare players across positions (15:45). Next, Bucky talks about his conversation with Falcons GM Thomas Dimitroff and how the team could potentially have 11 first-round picks starting on offense this upcoming season (24:09). item.title: Breaking Down Todd Gurley to Falcons & Lance's Mock Draft
item.itunes:title: Breaking Down Todd Gurley to Falcons & Lance's Mock Draft
item.description:
DJ, Bucky Brooks, Lance Zierlein and Rhett Lewis are back with a special new episode. To start off, the guys discuss the news of RB Todd Gurley being cut by the Rams and signed by the Falcons, while focusing on the value of the running back position (1:21). Next, they look at how there's no offseason right now with everything going on and the impact of that on new head coaches (12:09). Then, the guys talk about QB Tom Brady's fit in Tampa Bay (15:13). After that, the crew discuss CB Darius Slay's trade to the Eagles (18:32). To wrap up the show, DJ and Bucky react to Lance's most recent mock draft (25:25).

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.itunes:title: Reaction to Tom Brady to Bucs & Philip Rivers signing with Colts
item.description:
DJ and Bucky Brooks are back with a new episode. To start off, the guys discuss the news of QB Tom Brady agreeing to join the Buccaneers, while looking at his fit with the team and what's next for the Patriots (:40). Next, the pair break down why Philip Rivers signed with the Colts (12:21). After that, the duo talk about the Raiders most recent moves in free agency (18:37). Then, the guys explain the challenges of picking players that weren't invited to the combine (22:55). To wrap up the show, the pair discuss some more free agency moves and talk about how there's so many trades lately (26:40).

item.itunes:title: Breaking down trades of DeAndre Hopkins & Stefon Diggs + Free Agency News
item.description:
DJ and Bucky Brooks are back with a new episode. To start off, the guys discuss the Panthers giving QB Cam Newton permission to seek a trade (1:38) and how the Panthers are finalizing a deal with QB Teddy Bridgewater (4:08). Next, the pair analyzes the trades of WR DeAndre Hopkins to the Cardinals and WR Stefon Diggs to the Bills, while looking at what it means for each team involved (6:47). Then, the duo reacts to the trade of DT DeForest Buckner to the Colts and discuss what it means for the 49ers (15:14). After that, the guys talk about all the moves the Dolphins have made in free agency so far (19:55). Then, the pair look at the Bears (24:00) and Raiders moves in free agency (26:15). To wrap up the show, Bucky tells DJ about a pass rusher in this upcoming draft that is a tough evaluation (28:15).

To wrap up the show, DJ gives a few names that are in his updated top 50 prospects list (31:25).

item.title: Combine Recap - DL & LB + Chase Young & Prospect Interviews
item.itunes:title: Combine Recap - DL & LB + Chase Young & Prospect Interviews
item.description:
Bucky Brooks and Lance Zierlein are back with a special new episode from the 2020 NFL Scouting Combine. To start off, the guys recap what they saw from the defensive linemen at the combine, which includes edge rushers (0:45). After that, Bucky talks with South Carolina defensive tackle Javon Kinlaw about the adversity he's faced in his life (11:12). Next, Bucky interviews Penn State edge rusher Yetur Gross-Matos as he describes his experience at the combine (16:55). After that, Bucky talks with Ohio State edge rusher Chase Young about how playing at Ohio State has helped him (21:58). To wrap up the show, the guys discuss which linebackers stood out (27:29).

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.description:

item.title: Combine GM Interviews + TE & OL Preview
item.itunes:title: Combine GM Interviews + TE & OL Preview
item.description:
Daniel Jeremiah and Bucky Brooks are back with a special new episode from the 2020 NFL Scouting Combine. To start off, the guys react to the news of LSU QB Joe Burrow having small hands after they were measured (1:50). Next, the pair talk with Miami Dolphins GM Chris Grier as the Dolphins have a ton of picks in the draft this year (4:50). After that, the duo speak with Indianapolis Colts GM Chris Ballard about his philosophy on building a team (17:18). Then, the guys preview the top tight end prospects at the combine (29:07). Next, the pair look at the best offensive tackle prospects at the combine (31:28). To wrap up the show, the guys talk about the best interior offensive linemen here (34:36).

item.title: Reaction to Philip Rivers & Chargers parting ways
item.itunes:title: Reaction to Philip Rivers & Chargers parting ways
item.description:
Daniel Jeremiah and Bucky Brooks are back with a new episode. To start off, the guys group the top college running back prospects into tiers (4:55). Then, the pair react to the news of the Chargers and QB Philip Rivers parting ways as he's entering free agency, while also giving potential landing spots for him (20:58). After that, the guys give insight into the grading scale they use for evaluating players (30:00). Later, the duo talk about how the importance of having team staff members who have experience in both coaching and scouting (36:02). To wrap up the show, the pair discuss how scouts will navigate failed drug tests if the new CBA becomes more lenient regarding this topic (42:11).

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Super Bowl Takeaways
item.itunes:title: Super Bowl Takeaways
item.description:
Daniel Jeremiah, Bucky Brooks and Rhett Lewis recap the Super Bowl LIV game between the Chiefs and 49ers. To start off DJ discusses how QB Patrick Mahomes' mobility was the difference (2:08). Then, Bucky explains how the Chiefs defense and defensive coordinator Steve Spagnuolo made adjustments during the game (9:49). After that, Rhett analyzes why the 49ers will be back from this loss (18:28). To wrap up the show, the guys break down what type of players the league is trending towards (25:03).

item.title: How the Chiefs and 49ers built their teams
item.itunes:title: How the Chiefs and 49ers built their teams
item.description:
DJ and Bucky are back with a new episode. First, the pair breakdown the quarterbacks for the Super Bowl teams, while looking at how the Chiefs acquired QB Patrick Mahomes and the guys also focus on 49ers QB Jimmy Garoppolo (1:59). After, the duo discusses how each team's roster was constructed through the draft, free agency and trades (12:10). Then, the guys look at what path Chiefs GM Brett Veach and 49ers GM John Lynch took to get to their current jobs (22:46). To wrap up, DJ and Bucky compare Chiefs head coach Andy Reid and 49ers head coach Kyle Shanahan, with a focus on their offenses and coaching style (31:16).

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Senior Bowl Recap, Reaction to Kobe Bryant tragedy
item.itunes:title: Senior Bowl Recap, Reaction to Kobe Bryant tragedy
item.description:
Daniel Jeremiah and Bucky Brooks are back to recap the 2020 Senior Bowl. Before getting into football talk, the pair respond to the tragic accident claiming the lives of Kobe Bryant and eight others (0:15). After their discussion, DJ and Bucky call on a recent interview with Alabama edge rusher Terrell Lewis who discussed the influence Kobe had on his playing career (6:01). Then, the hosts dive back into football and recap the Senior Bowl, pointing to key highlights and takeaways from the game (8:56). To wrap up the show, DJ and Bucky bring in a group of star defensive players to discuss their respective journeys towards professional football. First they speak with Cal safety Ashtyn Davis (24:58), then Oklahoma defensive tackle Neville Gallimore (32:23), and finally Lenoir-Rhyne safety Kyle Dugger (41:59).

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.description:
Daniel Jeremiah, Bucky Brooks, Rhett Lewis and Lance Zierlein are back with a special episode from the Senior Bowl. To start off, the guys give their takeaways from Wednesday's practice (:39). Then, DJ and Bucky interview Arizona State wide receiver Brandon Aiyuk at the Senior Bowl (5:56). After, the guys talk with another wide receiver prospect in Liberty's Antonio Gandy-Golden (14:50). Then, Falcons GM Thomas Dimitroff speaks with Bucky about the franchise (20:26). To wrap up the show, Rhett reacts to the retirement announcement by Giants QB Eli Manning (26:56).

item.title: Reaction to Luke Kuechly retiring & Panthers hiring Joe Brady + Conference Championships preview
item.itunes:title: Reaction to Luke Kuechly retiring & Panthers hiring Joe Brady + Conference Championships preview
item.description:
Bucky Brooks and Rhett Lewis do a special episode from the NFLPA Collegiate Bowl practices. First, the guys react to the news of Panthers linebacker Luke Kuechly retiring (2:22) and then, they discuss the Panthers hiring LSU's Passing Game Coordinator and Wide Receivers coach Joe Brady as their new offensive coordinator (5:26). After, the duo preview the AFC and NFC Championship games, while looking at what each remaining team needs to do to win (10:56). Next, the pair look back at the 2016 NFL Draft and talk about their initial thoughts of Titans running back Derrick Henry when he was coming out of college (16:47). To wrap up the show, the guys highlight players you should watch out for from the NFLPA Collegiate Bowl (21:05).

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Divisional Round Takeaways
item.itunes:title: Divisional Round Takeaways
item.description:
Rhett Lewis and Bucky Brooks briefly discuss the Browns hiring Kevin Stefanski as head coach (1:10). Then, the guys recap the Divisional Round games from this weekend, including the Chiefs comeback victory over the Texans (3:55), Titans beat up the Ravens with their run game (16:10), and a lookahead to next week’s AFC Championship (25:40). Plus, Rhett & Bucky give their takeaways from the 49ers dominant win over the Vikings (29:05), Aaron Rodgers outdueling Russell Wilson at Lambeau Field (36:05) and lookahead to the NFC Championship (44:15).

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Reactions to Panthers hiring Matt Rhule & Giants hiring Joe Judge
item.itunes:title: Reactions to Panthers hiring Matt Rhule & Giants hiring Joe Judge
item.description:
DJ and Bucky are back with a new episode. To start off the show, the guys talk about the Browns request to interview Eagles defensive coordinator Jim Schwartz for their head coaching vacancy (1:09). After that, DJ and Bucky discuss what the Detroit Lions could do with the third-overall pick in the 2020 NFL Draft (5:52). Next, the duo reacts to the news of the Panthers hiring Baylor's Matt Rhule to be their head coach (10:51) and the news of the Giants hiring Patriots special teams coordinator and wide receivers coach Joe Judge to be their head coach (20:27). To wrap up, the pair evaluate the top three college quarterback prospects in the 2020 class (28:34).

item.title: How the Packers and Vikings built their teams
item.itunes:title: How the Packers and Vikings built their teams
item.description:
DJ and Bucky are back with a new episode. First, the guys react to the news of the Seahawks signing running back Marshawn Lynch (1:40). Then, they recap the Packers' Monday Night Football win against the Vikings (9:38). Next, the pair share what they thought about Packers QB Aaron Rodgers and Vikings QB Kirk Cousins when the quarterbacks came out of college, while reading their initial scouting reports on them (12:55). After, the duo discusses how each team's roster was constructed through the draft, free agency and trades (22:45). Then, the guys look at what path Packers GM Brian Gutekunst and Vikings GM Rick Spielman took to get to their current jobs (27:09). To wrap up, DJ and Bucky compare Packers head coach Matt LaFleur and Vikings head coach Mike Zimmer, with a focus on their coaching styles (29:49).

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: 10 Takeaways from Week 16
item.itunes:title: 10 Takeaways from Week 16
item.description:
Daniel Jeremiah, Rhett Lewis and Bucky Brooks are back to give their Week 16 takeaways, including the Raiders staying alive in the playoff hunt (1:31), the Patriots revealing their playoff identity (6:00), how Giants QB Daniel Jones and Redskins QB Dwayne Haskins will make the next decade of the NFC East exciting (9:37), why Eagles QB Carson Wentz is a magician (13:27), what the Bengals could potentially do with the first pick in the 2020 NFL Draft (20:51), the Ravens taking care of business (23:28), how the Saints can cause trouble for other NFC contenders (26:45), a look at Chiefs QB Patrick Mahomes' big game against the Bears (29:40), how the Seahawks are heading in the wrong direction (33:31), and why the 49ers offense keeps rolling (37:26). To wrap up the show, the guys preview next week's show, which will include moments from interviews with some of the best college football coaches in the country (39:45).

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Mark Brunell joins the show + Reaction to Jags firing Tom Coughlin
item.itunes:title: Mark Brunell joins the show + Reaction to Jags firing Tom Coughlin
item.description:
Daniel Jeremiah and Bucky Brooks discuss the Jaguars firing Tom Coughlin as Executive VP of Football Operations (0:46). The guys preview the three Saturday games on the Week 16 slate, including Texans-Buccaneers, Bills-Patriots, Rams-49ers, while specifically concentrating mainly on the Bills-Patriots (9:40). Plus, DJ and Bucky highlight the record-tying 12 Baltimore Ravens named to the Pro Bowl (17:19). Former Pro Bowl QB Mark Brunell joins the show to talk about his playing days and the quarterback position (27:27). To close the show, the guys answer fan questions (43:21).

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: What if the Patriots traded Tom Brady instead of Jimmy Garoppolo?
item.itunes:title: What if the Patriots traded Tom Brady instead of Jimmy Garoppolo?
item.description:
Daniel Jeremiah and Bucky Brooks are back to discuss a number of topics including what DJ learned at the Major League Baseball winter meetings this week and his interviews with former Rockies General Manager Dan O’Dowd (5:10) and current Cubs Executive Vice President/General Manager Jed Hoyer (9:30). The guys discuss the traits that translate from scouting across all sports and what is needed to build a winning culture (12:30). Then, DJ goes back in the ‘time machine’ to evaluate what would have happened if the Patriots traded Tom Brady instead of Jimmy Garoppolo in 2017(18:25)? DJ and Bucky also cover comments Troy Aikman made recently about being interested in a GM role down the line (26:10). The Senior Bowl roster will be revealed next week, and the guys revisit a conversation they had with QB Drew Lock from Mobile (32:00) and talk about the importance of the playing in the Senior Bowl. To close the show, DJ & Bucky answer a fan question from Apple Podcasts comments (36:10).

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.description:
Daniel Jeremiah & Rhett Lewis recap Week 13 of the NFL season, including the Texans big win over the Patriots (1:50), Ryan Tannehill’s Titans resurgence (5:30), the Bengals getting their first win (10:50), Bucs defeating the Jaguars (14:30), the Eagles struggle again (19:30), Steelers defense keeping them in playoff race (22:45), Drew Lock’s debut win (26:45), Rams offense shows life (30:30). item.title: 10 Takeaways from Week 12 & how Sam Darnold is dangerous when protected
item.itunes:title: 10 Takeaways from Week 12 & how Sam Darnold is dangerous when protected
item.description:
Daniel Jeremiah, Bucky Brooks and Rhett Lewis look back at the weekend and pick ten storylines that stood out from Week 12 of the NFL season. To start off, the guys discuss how Jets' QB Sam Darnold is dangerous when he's protected as he had an impressive performance against the Raiders (:29). Next, the trio look how the Patriots keep winning ugly and they dive into their Week 12 matchup vs. the Cowboys (5:14). Then, the guys analyze how Buccaneers' QB Jameis Winston has the best short-term memory in the league (11:11). Later, they talk about why the Saints will win the division, but not necessarily the NFC (22:39). After, the trio look at how the Browns are surging as the team had a dominant offensive performance in Week 12 (29:46). Towards the end of the episode, the guys go into detail on how good 49ers' tight end George Kittle is after he went off against the Packers (33:55). All that and more in this packed episode.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.description:
Daniel Jeremiah & Bucky Brooks break down the decision to draft a Quarterback to replace an aging veteran at the position (2:30). Former MVP & Pro Bowl QB, Boomer Esiason, joins the show to talk about QBs and how to succeed as a signal caller in the NFL (8:05). Plus, DJ & Bucky talk the importance of drafting in the second round and why it’s wise to load up on Day 2 picks in the draft (30:40). To end the show, the guys answer fan questions (38:55).

item.title: When the Chargers should look for their next QB & Brian Schottenheimer details what makes Russell Wilson special
item.itunes:title: When the Chargers should look for their next QB & Brian Schottenheimer details what makes Russell Wilson special
item.description:
Rhett Lewis and Bucky are back with a new episode. First, the guys talk about the Chiefs' Monday Night Football win against the Chargers and specifically discuss when the Chargers should look for their next QB, while giving a few names of college quarterbacks who could fit on the team from this upcoming draft class (:31). Next, the pair react to Alabama QB Tua Tagovailoa's injury and analyze if he should stay in college for another season or enter the draft, as the injury could hurt his draft stock (11:05). Then, the duo talk about a player who also had a bad injury and was projected to be a very high pick (21:49). After, Rhett and Bucky look at which college quarterbacks will rise in the draft if Tua potentially slides (24:37). The guys also highlight Oklahoma QB Jalen Hurts' impressive comeback win over Baylor and project how high he could be drafted (28:43). To wrap up the episode, Seattle Seahawks' offensive coordinator Brian Schottenheimer joins the podcast to discuss what makes Seahawks' QB Russell Wilson special and his philosophy on offense (32:40).

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: 10 Takeaways from Week 11 & how Dak Prescott is proving his worth
item.itunes:title: 10 Takeaways from Week 11 & how Dak Prescott is proving his worth
item.description:
Daniel Jeremiah, Bucky Brooks and Rhett Lewis look back at the weekend and pick ten storylines that stood out from Week 11 of the NFL season. To start off, the guys discuss how the Ravens' pass rush showed up against the Texans (2:54). Next, the trio look at the Vikings' comeback win over the Broncos and their impressive second half performance (8:24). Then, the guys analyze how Cowboys' QB Dak Prescott is proving his worth after his dominant game vs. the Lions (11:31). Later, they go into detail on Raiders' head coach Jon Gruden's positive impact on QB Derek Carr, as Carr is playing great football this season (23:18). Bucky also points out Jimmy Garoppolo's clutch moment from Week 11, but goes on to discuss why he's still the weakest link on the 49ers (35:56). To wrap up the episode, the trio talk about the Rams making running back Todd Gurley the focal point of their offense once again (46:10). All that and more in this packed episode.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Evolution of Lamar Jackson & Deshaun Watson, plus a look back at their college matchup in 2016
item.itunes:title: Evolution of Lamar Jackson & Deshaun Watson, plus a look back at their college matchup in 2016
item.description:
DJ and Bucky are back with a new episode. First, the pair take a look back at their initial thoughts of quarterbacks Lamar Jackson and Deshaun Watson after the two QBs faced off in 2016 during college and the guys discuss why each QB is special (1:57). Next, DJ and Bucky react to LSU QB Joe Burrow and Alabama QB Tua Tagovailoa's matchup from this past weekend, while giving their analysis on the skillset of each player (14:20). After, the duo talk about some of the top wide receivers in college football and explain why this upcoming wide receiver draft class is one of the deepest in history (29:47). Then, the guys compare the top first-round and second-round wide receivers in the last four drafts and see which group is performing better in the NFL (36:30). Later, DJ breaks out another edition of "hits & misses" as he looks back at two players he missed on from the 2016 NFL Draft (48:16). To wrap up the show, the pair answer fan questions, which were left in the reviews (54:22).

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: How the Seahawks and 49ers built their teams
item.itunes:title: How the Seahawks and 49ers built their teams
item.description:
DJ and Bucky are back with a new episode. First, the guys recap the Seahawks' Monday Night Football win against the 49ers and give their takeaways from the game (2:54). Next, the pair share what they thought about Seahawks' QB Russell Wilson (21:15) and 49ers' QB Jimmy Garoppolo (31:35) when the quarterbacks came out of college, while discussing how the players developed in the league. After, the duo discusses how each team's roster was constructed through the draft, free agency and trades (37:55). Then, the guys look at what path 49ers' GM John Lynch and Seahawks' GM John Schneider took to get to their current jobs (53:25). To wrap up, DJ and Bucky compare Seahawks' head coach Pete Carroll and 49ers' head coach Kyle Shanahan, with a focus on their offenses and coaching style (1:03:29).

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: 10 Takeaways from Week 10 & why Kyler Murray is the future
item.itunes:title: 10 Takeaways from Week 10 & why Kyler Murray is the future
item.description:
Daniel Jeremiah, Bucky Brooks and Rhett Lewis look back at the weekend and pick ten storylines that stood out from Week 10 of the NFL season. To start off, the guys discuss how the Saints didn't play well against the Falcons (1:27). Next, the trio analyze how Ravens' QB Lamar Jackson has entered the MVP race after his dominant performance against the Bengals (5:49). After that, the guys rave about the Steelers' defense and specifically how their pressure helped them beat the Rams (10:36). Later, they look at how Titans' QB Ryan Tannehill led the team to a victory over the Chiefs (21:42). The guys also react to the Browns getting back on track after their win over the Bills (33:43). To wrap up the episode, they talk about how Cardinals' QB Kyler Murray is the future of the team (44:42). All that and more in this packed episode.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

To wrap up the episode, they talk about how Cardinals' QB Kyler Murray is the future of the team (44:42). All that and more in this packed episode.

item.title: Most impressive & disappointing position units this season
item.itunes:title: Most impressive & disappointing position units this season
item.description:
DJ & Bucky begin the show discussing the Nationals’ world series win over the Astros and what you can learn from the Nats losing Bryce Harper in the offseason and winning it all (0:20). Then, the guys discuss the most impressive, disappointing & rising position units in the NFL: Wide Receivers (6:00), Running Back (13:30), Pass Rushers (20:40), Secondary (27:50). Jake Heaps, Director of Operations & Head QB coach of the Russell Wilson QB Academy, joins DJ & Bucky to discuss working with the Pro Bowl QB and what it takes to develop a Quarterback (33:50). To close the show, the guys answer fan questions (1:00:30). item.title: Lance Zierlein evaluates recent QB draft classes & college players
item.itunes:title: Lance Zierlein evaluates recent QB draft classes & college players
item.description:
DJ is joined by NFL Media's Lance Zierlein on this new episode. First, the guys talk about trade rumors surrounding the Jets and look ahead to how the Jets can help QB Sam Darnold in the future (1:14). Then, the pair recap the Steelers' Monday Night Football win against the Dolphins and concentrate on Steelers' safety Minkah Fitzpatrick's big game (9:16). After, the duo discuss how the Houston Astros built their team and talk about the impact of veteran players being invested in younger players (10:35). Next, DJ and Lance look at the progress of quarterbacks from the 2017 and 2018 NFL Drafts (14:29). Then, Lance gives his takeaways from the current rookie QB class (23:03). Next, the pair talk about college players to watch out for (27:46). To wrap up, DJ reacts to the Bengals naming QB Ryan Finley their starter, while benching QB Andy Dalton (36:29).

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.itunes:title: Best short players ever scouted, Brian Kelly talks Notre Dame's culture & former players
item.description:
DJ and Bucky are back with a new episode. First, the pair discuss Emmanuel Sanders' trade to the 49ers and how he fits with the team (:50). Next, DJ and Bucky give names of some of the best short players they've ever scouted (2:44). Then, the guys compare two tight ends in the league for National Tight Ends Day on Sunday (9:08). After that, DJ and Bucky talk to Notre Dame head football coach Brian Kelly about the culture of the team and he tells stories about the players he's coached (13:27). Next, the duo react to Urban Meyer expressing interest in becoming the Cowboys' head coach (34:34). Later, the pair focus on college players you should watch out for and specifically, discuss players from Wisconsin and Ohio State ahead of their matchup this weekend (37:55). To wrap up the show, the pair answer fan questions, which were left in the reviews (42:51).

item.title: Football/Basketball Crossover with LeBron James' HS football coach, Tony Romo's HS basketball coach & Tom Crean
item.itunes:title: Football/Basketball Crossover with LeBron James' HS football coach, Tony Romo's HS basketball coach & Tom Crean
item.description:
DJ and Bucky are back with a special episode, which focuses on multi-sport athletes and specifically, the guys look at the crossover between football and basketball. To start, the pair talk to University of Georgia's head basketball coach Tom Crean about what he saw from Dwyane Wade when he coached him at Marquette and also about the similarities between basketball and football players (2:38). Next, the duo speak with Tony Romo's high school basketball coach Steven Berezowitz, as he discusses how talented Romo was as a basketball player (19:28). Then, Colorado's head football coach Mel Tucker tells the guys about the best high school football player he's ever seen (33:09). After, DJ and Bucky interview LeBron James' high school football coach Jim Meyer from St. Vincent-St. Mary high school about James' NFL comparison and if James could have played in the NFL (35:11). Later, the guys look back at a conversation they had with Baylor's head football coach Matt Rhule about why he likes multi-sport athletes (47:06). To wrap up, DJ and Bucky each give names of some of the best multi-sport athletes they've ever seen (50:45).

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: 10 takeaways from Week 6 & why Deshaun Watson is a MVP candidate
item.itunes:title: 10 takeaways from Week 6 & why Deshaun Watson is a MVP candidate
item.description:
Daniel Jeremiah, Bucky Brooks and Rhett Lewis look back at the weekend and pick ten storylines that stood out from Week 6 of the NFL season. item.itunes:title: Dabo Swinney discusses Clemson's special culture & praises his former QB Deshaun Watson
item.description:
DJ and Bucky are back with a new episode. To start, the guys look at if success is measured based on regular season wins or World Series titles, while focusing on the Los Angeles Dodgers (:38). Then, DJ and Bucky pick who they think are the top three innovators in football right now (8:06). After that, Devlin Hodges and Gardner Minshew's QB trainer David Morris joins the podcast, as he tells us more about the two quarterbacks (16:05). Next, Clemson head coach Dabo Swinney talks to the guys about Clemson's special culture and he also praises his former QB Deshaun Watson (31:54). After that, DJ breaks out another edition of "hits & misses" as he looks back at a player he hit on and a player he missed on from the 2017 NFL Draft (1:01:31). To wrap up the show, the pair answer fan questions, which were left in the reviews (1:09:54).

item.title: MNF recap of 49ers' dominant win & importance of OL in team-building process
item.itunes:title: MNF recap of 49ers' dominant win & importance of OL in team-building process
item.description:
DJ and Bucky are back with a new episode. First, the guys recap the 49ers' Monday Night Football win against the Browns and look at why the 49ers are doing so well (2:40). Next, the pair analyze Chiefs head coach Andy Reid's offensive scheme compared to 49ers head coach Kyle Shanahan's offensive scheme (13:07). After, the duo discusses if family athletic history impacts athletes and if it leads to success or not, while focusing on the Bosa family (16:47). Later in the episode, the guys go into detail about how current division leaders invested in their offensive line and emphasize how important a good offensive line is in the team-building process (22:24). Next, DJ and Bucky talk about a few college players they like (28:27). To wrap up, the pair discuss what college coaches could make a move to the NFL after the firing of head coach Jay Gruden by the Redskins (33:04).

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: 10 takeaways from Week 5 & reaction to Jay Gruden's firing
item.itunes:title: 10 takeaways from Week 5 & reaction to Jay Gruden's firing
item.description:
Daniel Jeremiah, Bucky Brooks and Rhett Lewis look back at the weekend and pick ten storylines that stood out from Week 5 of the NFL season. To start off, the guys react to the Redskins firing of head coach Jay Gruden (:19). Then, the trio discusses how the Broncos dominated on defense to beat the Chargers (8:06). Later in the episode, they analyze Texans' QB Deshaun Watson and WR Will Fuller's impressive performances against the Falcons (14:29). After, the crew talks about how good of a job Raiders' head coach Jon Gruden is doing in Oakland (22:52). The guys also give credit to the Colts after their upset win over the Chiefs (35:29). To wrap up, the crew looks at if Panthers' RB Christian McCaffrey is the best back in the NFL (40:45). All that and more in this packed episode.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.description:
DJ and Bucky are back, the guys discuss DJ’s latest Top 25 rookies list (2:00), the differences between athletic Centers vs. power centers (10:20). Then, Notre Dame football Director of Player Personnel Dave Peloquin joins the show to talk about building the Irish into a national power (22:20). Plus, DJ breaks out another edition of “hits & misses” as he looks back at some of his former draft evaluations (39:28). To close the show, the guys look ahead at the biggest Week 6 college games (48:05) & answer a few fan questions (50:20).

item.title: Bill Keenist’s stories on Calvin Johnson & Barry Sanders, current NFL comparisons for Johnson & Sanders
item.itunes:title: Bill Keenist’s stories on Calvin Johnson & Barry Sanders, current NFL comparisons for Johnson & Sanders
item.description:
DJ and Bucky are back with a new episode. Early in the episode, the pair react to the MNF game between the Bengals and Steelers and look at Steelers' QB Mason Rudolph’s performance (8:59). Next, the guys evaluate the skill of players vs. how much the scheme they play in matters and specifically focus on Jaguars' QB Gardner Minshew (11:59). After, the duo are joined by Detroit Lions' team historian Bill Keenist, as he recalls stories and memories of former Lions' RB Barry Sanders and WR Calvin Johnson (18:02). Then, DJ and Bucky each give their current NFL comparisons for Sanders (45:50) and Johnson (49:51). To wrap up, the pair discuss some of the top college players in the country and also give names of the top offensive tackles in college football (52:51).

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Reaction to Melvin Gordon ending holdout, Gary Andersen talks Utah State's culture and QB Jordan Love
item.itunes:title: Reaction to Melvin Gordon ending holdout, Gary Andersen talks Utah State's culture and QB Jordan Love
item.description:
DJ and Bucky are back with a new episode. To start off, the pair react to the news of Chargers' RB Melvin Gordon ending his contract holdout (1:41). Next, the guys preview the Giants and Redskins Week 4 game and discuss what they expect from Giants' QB Daniel Jones in his second start (8:07). DJ and Bucky also talk about their early college evaluations on Browns' QB Baker Mayfield, from when he was still at Oklahoma (13:22). After that, the guys talk to Utah State's head coach Gary Andersen about the culture at Utah State and his thoughts on his QB Jordan Love (23:19). The pair then give their own evaluations on Love and analyze which of his traits are similar to Patrick Mahomes (37:12). Next, DJ and Bucky talk about the top college football quarterbacks and which NFL teams could look at one in next year's draft (40:38). To wrap up the episode, DJ surprises Bucky with a gift from App State's head coach Eliah Drinkwitz (49:02).

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Reaction to Daniel Jones being named Giants' starting QB, Bob Stoops talks building a team
item.itunes:title: Reaction to Daniel Jones being named Giants' starting QB, Bob Stoops talks building a team
item.description:
DJ and Bucky are back with a new episode. To start off, the guys react to the news of Giants' QB Daniel Jones being named the starter (1:31). Next, the pair discuss cornerback Jalen Ramsey requesting a trade from the Jaguars (8:24), safety Minkah Fitzpatrick's trade to the Steelers (12:22), and QB Cam Newton's injury news (20:23). After, the duo give an analysis of the Monday Night Football game between the Browns and the Jets (31:32). Then, the guys talk to former Oklahoma head coach and current head coach and GM of the XFL's Dallas Renegades Bob Stoops about his new job opportunity and his philosophy on building a team (37:18). To wrap up the episode, DJ and Bucky give their expectations and initial scouting reports on new QB starters Mason Rudolph and Teddy Bridgewater (48:17).

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.itunes:title: Do the Saints or Rams have the better roster? Mark Pantoni talks recruiting Ezekiel Elliott and other Ohio State players
item.description:
DJ and Bucky are back before Week 2 of the NFL regular season. First, the pair preview the Saints vs. Rams rematch this week (8:37) and look at the Vikings' offense vs. the Packers' defense in their upcoming matchup (12:37). Next, the guys compare Lamar Jackson and Kyler Murray as they get set to play in Week 2 (15:12). Then, DJ and Bucky talk to Ohio State's assistant athletic director for player personnel Mark Pantoni about him scouting and recruiting former and current Ohio State players such as Ezekiel Elliott, Joey Bosa, Nick Bosa, Joe Burrow and Chase Young (20:22). After, the guys give advice to people who want to break into the scouting industry (35:44). To wrap up the episode, the pair evaluate three college players you should watch out for in Week 3 (40:07).

item.title: Thoughts on Ezekiel Elliott's contract extension, Jordan Palmer talks young QBs, Packers vs. Bears prediction
item.itunes:title: Thoughts on Ezekiel Elliott's contract extension, Jordan Palmer talks young QBs, Packers vs. Bears prediction
item.description:
DJ and Bucky are back before Week 1 of the NFL regular season. First, the pair gives their thoughts on the recent contract extensions of Dallas Cowboys running back Ezekiel Elliott and Los Angeles Rams quarterback Jared Goff (1:34). Next, they preview the Green Bay Packers and Chicago Bears NFL opener and each pick who they think will win the game (15:56). After that, former NFL QB and current QB trainer Jordan Palmer joins the podcast to discuss some of the young quarterbacks he’s trained that are in the NFL and he talks about a few of the top college quarterbacks (18:36). To wrap up the episode, the guys dive into storylines from the NFC and AFC West divisions and pick division winners (37:40).

item.title: Antonio Brown drama in Oakland, Preseason Week 1 takeaways, NFC/AFC North previews
item.itunes:title: Antonio Brown drama in Oakland, Preseason Week 1 takeaways, NFC/AFC North previews
item.description:
DJ and Bucky are back following the first full weekend of preseason football. Before getting into their takeaways from the games, the pair address the latest off-field reports regarding Antonio Brown, who Bucky has taken exception with (4:11). Next, the guys get into what they saw in the latest slate of preseason games (8:47), and discuss what they saw from rookie QBs Kyler Murray, Daniel Jones, Dwayne Haskins, and Drew Lock. After that, DJ and Bucky dive into the NFC and AFC North, previewing what to watch in the divisions and making their predictions regarding which teams will be heading to the playoffs (22:10). Later, the podcast takes a special look at the Dallas Cowboys featuring Bucky's interviews from training camp with key defensive backs Xavier Woods, Jeff Heath, and Chidobe Awuzie (34:28). These interviews spark conversation about key running back holdouts Ezekiel Elliott (DAL), and Melvin Gordon (LAC). Check out more from the Move the Sticks Podcast at YouTube.com/NFLPodcasts

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: 32 Irreplaceable Players
item.itunes:title: 32 Irreplaceable Players
item.description:
According to DJ and Bucky, every team in the NFL has at least one IRREPLACEABLE player and in this episode, the duo reveal that list (7:05)! Before they do, the pair reveal some of their notes from training camp visits over the past couple of weeks (1:34). They give updates on the Eagles, Texans, Bills, and Giants, highlighting key players to watch during preseason games. At each stop, DJ interviews a key player at the quarterback position, beginning with Houston's Deshaun Watson (30:52), Philadelphia's Carson Wentz (34:54), Buffalo's Josh Allen (40:43), and New York's Daniel Jones (49:04).

item.description:
In the Move the Sticks prototype series finale, DJ & Bucky dive into the cornerback position. First, the guys discuss the CB attributes they look for when scouting the defensive secondary (2:20). Next, we hear from a panel of cornerback experts: 13-year NFL veteran Shawn Springs (6:27), former Jets defensive coordinator Dennis Thurman (20:11), and finally Senior Bowl executive director Jim Nagy (38:49). Finally, DJ and Bucky round out the show by naming who they believe to be the prototype CB of today's game (41:38). As the hosts explain in the episode, a "prototype" could look different to different coaches.

item.title: Pac-12 preview with top players and coaches (Justin Herbert, Laviska Shenault, Chris Petersen, Herm Edwards)
item.itunes:title: Pac-12 preview with top players and coaches (Justin Herbert, Laviska Shenault, Chris Petersen, Herm Edwards)
item.description:
DJ and Bucky make a special trip to Hollywood for Pac-12 media day! On this episode, the MTS crew discusses how to build a championship team with some of the most successful Pac-12 coaches. They chat with Stanford's David Shaw (1:57), Oregon's Mario Cristobal (9:04), Chip Kelly of UCLA (14:24), Washington head coach Chris Peterson (27:58), and finally Herm Edwards of Arizona State (35:52). After that, DJ and Bucky spend time with two Pac-12 players that are likely to be drafted near the top of the first round in the 2020 NFL Draft. First it's Oregon QB and Heisman hopeful Justin Herbert (47:09), followed by Colorado WR Laviska Shenault (53:59), who might be this year's number one receiver.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Inside USC Football with Clay Helton, Graham Harrell, and Keary Colbert
item.itunes:title: Inside USC Football with Clay Helton, Graham Harrell, and Keary Colbert
item.description:
In a special edition of Move the Sticks, DJ and Bucky visit the campus of the University of Southern California to meet with several coaches from the Trojans football program. The MTS crew discusses game scheming, culture, and how the Trojans prepare young athletes for the NFL. First, the duo is joined by first year offensive coordinator Graham Harrell (3:33), followed by Keary Colbert (20:25), who is transitioning from tight ends coach to wide receivers coach this year. Finally, head coach Clay Helton discusses the evolution of Trojan football as he enters a key year with the program (37:38).

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Teams that could trade their future to win now
item.itunes:title: Teams that could trade their future to win now
item.description:
DJ & Bucky compare the Anthony Davis NBA trade blockbuster to a common NFL GM decision around building a team depth vs. adding stars (2:11). They go on to list teams that are in position to mortgage their future and trade future draft picks for top players today. The duo also discuss which 2nd year players have something to prove entering the 2019 season (30:34). Plus, two NFL general managers join the show: Falcons GM Thomas Dimitroff (15:26), and Titans GM Jon Robinson (37:49) to discuss their off-season team-building strategies.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Which teams’ stock are you buying for 2019?
item.itunes:title: Which teams’ stock are you buying for 2019?
item.description:
DJ & Bucky give their take on the latest General Manager news, including the Jets hiring of Joe Douglas and the Texans firing of Brian Gaine (2:24). The guys also debate if the Eagles made the right decision giving Carson Wentz a 4-year contract extension (16:59). Then later in the show, Bucky recaps his trip to the Senior Bowl Scout School Summit (19:11). Also, Chargers General Manager Tom Telesco joins the show to talk about team depth, quarterback contracts & more (24:22). DJ & Bucky wrap things up with the top 3 teams whose stock they're buying for 2019 (39:08).

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Offensive stocks we’re buying heading into 2019
item.itunes:title: Offensive stocks we’re buying heading into 2019
item.description:
DJ & Bucky are back together after some vacation and have plenty to talk about. They guys kick things off with Bucky recapping what he learned in his recent visit with the Hamilton Tiger-Cats of the Canadian Football League (1:26). The guys then break down Bucky’s recent list of the NFL’s top 5 pass-catching groups (9:20). Later in the show, Super Bowl winning coach Mike Holmgren joins the guys to discuss the QB situation in New York with Eli Manning & Daniel Jones, as well as his incredible coaching tree (14:08). DJ & Bucky wrap things up with the players whose stocks they’re buying heading into 2019 (30:25).

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Are the Patriots or Warriors a better dynasty?
item.itunes:title: Are the Patriots or Warriors a better dynasty?
item.description:
Daniel Jeremiah & Rhett Lewis are back again with an action-packed show. The guys kick things off by ranking the best new tag teams created through free agency and the draft (2:08). Next, best-selling author Ken Coleman joins the guys to talk leadership and chasing your dreams (13:07). Then with the NBA Finals set to tip off, DJ & Rhett wrap things up by debating which dynasty is more impressive: The New England Patriots or the Golden State Warriors (41:56)?

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Have the division leaders gotten better or worse?
item.itunes:title: Have the division leaders gotten better or worse?
item.description:
DJ is back from vacation and joined by Rhett Lewis for a big-time show. The guys kick things off by discussing DJ's recent trip to see Peyton Manning talk at a leadership summit (4:21). After that, former NFL QB and current ESPN analyst Dan Orlovsky joins the program to talk about the best leaders he's played with, as well as this year's rookie QB class (21:36). DJ also surprises Orlovsky by reading him his own scouting report from 2005, when he was coming out of UConn (44:50). The guys wrap things up by analyzing if last year's division winners have gotten better or worse this offseason (53:11).

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
item.content:encoded:
DJ is back from vacation and joined by Rhett Lewis for a big-time show. The guys kick things off by discussing DJ's recent trip to see Peyton Manning talk at a leadership summit (4:21). After that, former NFL QB and current ESPN analyst Dan Orlovsky joins the program to talk about the best leaders he's played with, as well as this year's rookie QB class (21:36). DJ also surprises Orlovsky by reading him his own scouting report from 2005, when he was coming out of UConn (44:50). The guys wrap things up by analyzing if last year's division winners have gotten better or worse this offseason (53:11).

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Kyler Murray 360
item.itunes:title: Kyler Murray 360
item.description:
DJ & Bucky scout Oklahoma QB Kyler Murray. The guys cover three elements of Murray’s journey as the 2019 NFL Draft approaches: His winning ability throughout his football career (1:00), being a dual-sport star (21:20), and comparing Murray with former Oklahoma QB Baker Mayfield (38:50). Interviews include his high school offensive coordinator, national college football analysts, college coaches that played against him, teammates of his at OU, Sooners head coach Lincoln Riley and, of course, the Heisman trophy winner himself.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Clemson Defensive Line 360
item.itunes:title: Clemson Defensive Line 360
item.description:
DJ & Bucky scout the Clemson Defensive Line: Clelin Ferrell, Christian Wilkins, Dexter Lawrence and Austin Bryant. The guys interview several people close to the D-Linemen, including an elementary school principal (6:50) who knows Christian Wilkins well, Bucky’s father, Blake Brooks, who happened to coach Dexter Lawrence in H.S. (24:30), and Clelin Ferrell’s H.S. coach Greg Lilly (38:10) to talk about the character and perseverance of the edge rusher. Plus, ESPN scouting analyst Tom Luginbill talks about the DL when they were being recruited (50:20), Clemson head coach Dabo Swinney (57:00) & interviews from the 4 prospects themselves: Austin Bryant & Clelin Ferrell (58:45), Christian Wilkins & Dexter Lawrence (1:04:55).

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.description:
DJ & Bucky scout one of the top QB prospects in the 2019 NFL Draft, Ohio State’s Dwayne Haskins. The guys interview several people close to Haskins, including his high school coach Pat Cilento (4:12), Ohio State head coach Ryan Day (12:15), his mentor & former Pro Bowl CB Shawn Springs (19:30), OSU teammates DE Nick Bosa (31:55), WR Parris Campbell (32:40), DT Dre’Mont Jones (34:35), and conclude with interviews from the man himself, Dwayne Haskins (36:50). Plus, DJ & Bucky break down Haskins’ ceiling & floor and give their pro comparisons for Haskins (45:10).

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Gronk Retires, Value of the Slot Receiver, Ed Oliver Breakdown
item.itunes:title: Gronk Retires, Value of the Slot Receiver, Ed Oliver Breakdown
item.description:
Bucky is joined by Lance Zierlein to discuss Rob Gronkowski’s retirement (1:40) and what it means for the Patriots upcoming draft. They also break down the value of the slot receiver (13:00). Lance and Bucky give a few names of prospects they would “pound the table” to draft if they were in the war room next month (25:30). They conclude the podcast by analyzing Ed Oliver’s potential and where he fits in best as he heads to the NFL (39:05).

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Kyler Murray vs. Dwayne Haskins, Clemson DL Interviews
item.itunes:title: Kyler Murray vs. Dwayne Haskins, Clemson DL Interviews
item.description:
With DJ traveling for multiple pro days this week, Bucky Brooks is joined by Lance Zierlein on today’s show to discuss Montez Sweat’s heart condition (14:00), what Ryan Fitzpatrick’s signing with Miami means for the QB market in the draft (18:00). Then, the guys debate which prospect they would have No. 1 on their positional “big board” with QBs Kyler Murray vs. Dwayne Haskins (23:20), WRs D.K. Metcalf vs. Marquise Brown (26:10), Edge Rushers Nick Bosa vs. Josh Allen (31:00), LBs Devin White vs. Devin Bush (34:00). Bucky caught up with all 4 Clemson starting defensive linemen early this month (40:20), and to close the show, the guys put on their scouting caps to hypothetically address if Zion Williamson would enter the draft, would he be a first round pick? (58:15)

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.itunes:title: OBJ trade reaction, Le’Veon is a Jet, Bucky’s latest Top 5 position list
item.description:
Bucky is joined today by producer Kent Brown due to DJ being grounded in OKC after Kyler Murray’s pro day. The guys breakdown OBJ’s trade to the Cleveland Browns (1:31), what the next steps are for the New York Football Giants (12:05) and what we can expect from the New York Jets with the addition of Le’Veon Bell (17:59). Bucky discusses Kyler Murray’s pro day (28:17) and they cap off the show with Bucky breaking down his Top 5 position rankings for the 2019 NFL Draft (40:59).

item.title: Strengths & Weaknesses of 2019 Draft Class, Combine Interviews: QB, OL
item.itunes:title: Strengths & Weaknesses of 2019 Draft Class, Combine Interviews: QB, OL
item.description:
DJ & Bucky discuss NFL draft strengths and weaknesses kicking off with the defensive side first (1:42) then they break down the offensive side (11:58). Bucky caught up with several of the top prospects at the Combine down on the field at Lucas Oli Stadium in Indianapolis. First up is his interview with Missouri QB Drew Lock (19:39), then Bucky chats with Duke QB Daniel Jones (25:37). Finally, Bucky wraps up his interviews with three stand out Offensive Lineman, Washington State’s Andre Dillard (32:47), Florida’s Jawaan Taylor (36:11) and Oklahoma’s Cody Ford (38:24).

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Combine Recap, Ohio State Coach Ryan Day joins the show!
item.itunes:title: Combine Recap, Ohio State Coach Ryan Day joins the show!
item.description:
DJ & Bucky are back from Indianapolis to recap the 2019 NFL Scouting Combine (2:10). The guys address Charley Casserly’s comments on Kyler Murray (4:20) and Josh Rosen (10:45). Plus, reports that the Chiefs are working on a record-setting deal for Tyreek Hill (13:55) and Antonio Brown is expected to be traded later this week (17:00). DJ goes through his post-Combine Mock Draft (22:40) and to close the show, Ohio State Head Coach Ryan Day caught up with Bucky at the Combine in Indianapolis to talk about his players in the draft and expectations for his first full season as the head coach of the Buckeyes (31:45).

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Chris Rose on Kyler Murray & Kareem Hunt, Top RBs in 2019 Draft

item.description:
DJ & Bucky begin the show giving their takes on Kyler Murray’s decision to choose football over baseball (0:20). NFL Media and MLB Network’s Chris Rose joins the show to break down if Kyler Murray made the right choice (9:25) and his take on his Cleveland Browns signing Kareem Hunt (15:20). DJ & Bucky then focus on their thoughts about whether the Browns made the right move in signing Hunt (26:40). Closing the show, DJ discusses the top Running Backs in the draft and which traits you can look for at the combine to match the NFL’s elite players at the position (33:00).
